info.name: Digibase API
info.description: API collection for Digibase - a dynamic database management platform with authentication, dynamic models, database explorer, and more.

item.name: Authentication

request.description: Register a new user account. Returns user data and authentication token.
Authenticate user and receive access token.
Request a password reset link to be sent to the user's email.
Reset user password using the token received via email.
Get public application settings including branding and enabled features.
Get list of available OAuth providers (Google, GitHub).
Redirect to OAuth provider for authentication.
Handle OAuth provider callback after authentication.
Get the currently authenticated user's information. Requires authentication.
Logout the current user and invalidate the access token.

item.description: Public authentication endpoints for user registration, login, and password management.

item.name: Core Data API (v1)

variable.description: Name of the table to query

request.description: Get paginated list of records from a table.
Get the schema/structure of a table including columns and their types.
Get a single record by ID from a table.
Create a new record in a table.
Update an existing record by ID.
Delete a record by ID from a table.

item.description: Core Data API endpoints with API key authentication. Provides CRUD operations for dynamic tables.

item.name: Dynamic Models

request.description: Get all available field types for dynamic models.
Get all dynamic models for the authenticated user.
Get a specific dynamic model with its fields and relationships.

body.raw:
{
  "name": "Post",
  "display_name": "Blog Posts",
  "description": "Blog post entries",
  "icon": "document",
  "has_timestamps": true,
  "has_soft_deletes": false,
  "generate_api": true,
  "fields": [
    {
      "name": "title",
      "display_name": "Title",
      "type": "string",
      "is_required": true,
      "is_searchable": true
    },
    {
      "name": "content",
      "display_name": "Content",
      "type": "richtext",
      "is_required": false
    }
  ]
}

request.description: Create a new dynamic model with fields. This will generate the database table.
Update an existing dynamic model's metadata.
Delete a dynamic model and its database table.
Add new fields to an existing dynamic model.

body.raw:
{
  "display_name": "Updated Field Name",
  "description": "Field description",
  "is_required": true,
  "is_searchable": true,
  "is_filterable": true
}

request.description: Update an existing field's properties.
Delete a field from a dynamic model and remove its column from the database.

item.description: Visual Model Creator - manage dynamic database models and their fields.

request.description: Get database statistics including total tables, rows, and top tables by size.
Get all tables in the database (excludes protected system tables).
Get table structure including columns, types, and indexes.
Get paginated data from a table with sorting and search.

variable.description: Name of the table (must be a dynamic model table)

request.description: Insert a new row into a dynamic model table.
Update a row in a dynamic model table.
Delete a row from a dynamic model table.
Execute a read-only SQL SELECT query. Only SELECT queries are allowed for safety.
Get all users.
Get a specific user by ID.
Create a new user.
Update an existing user.
Delete a user.
Get all available permissions.
Get all roles.
Get a specific role by ID.
Create a new role with permissions.
Update an existing role.
Delete a role.

item.name: API Keys (Tokens)

request.description: Get all API keys for the authenticated user.
Create a new API key.
Delete an API key.

item.description: API key management for accessing the Core Data API.

request.description: Get list of all migrations and their status.
Run pending database migrations.
Rollback the last batch of migrations.
Generate code based on specified parameters.
Get the Digibase JavaScript SDK for client-side integration.

item.name: Reverb (WebSockets)

request.description: WebSocket connection URL. After connecting, send the subscription message: {"event":"pusher:subscribe","data":{"channel":"test-channel"}}

item.description: Real-time event testing via Reverb WebSockets.
